commitResults.messageTitle: Rename chatbot, Add greet and exit
Add Main.java and implement echo and exit functions
Add Todo class and implement task list function
commitResults.messageBody:
Any user input will be added to a task list, except the input 'list'.
When the user inputs 'list', Appal will list out current tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Todo class to Task and add mark tasks function
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can mark a task as done with the input "mark <task number>", and
unmark the task with the input "unmark <task number>"

commitResults.messageTitle: Adjust layout to follow coding standard
Task class: Add subclasses ToDo, Deadline, Event
Appal.java: Improve readability in handleInput()
commitResults.messageBody:
Extracted the welcome message, as the code fragment can be grouped
together.

Using switch() along with constants instead of if-else control flow
makes code more understandable, for example to understand valid command
inputs.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Parser class and remove magic literals
commitResults.messageBody:
Adding the Parser class helps to extract details from the user input,
improving code readability in the Appal.java class.

Removing magic literals through through the use of constants also
improves code quality, by defining the values used in words.

Switch statements are also in-line to follow coding standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify files for automated testing
commitResults.messageBody: Trying out input output redirection for one user input

commitResults.messageTitle: Appal.java and Parser.java: Improve code readability
commitResults.messageBody:
Appal.java: Added more named constants, as well as abstracted out the
method printMessage() as it appears quite often in the code.

Parser.java: Added a named constant to make the start of the code more
understandable, and added more details of how the Parser extracts
parameters in user input in the comments.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code readability and aesthetic
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a named constant for the value 100 to indicate the maximum number
of tasks to be stores, as well as renamed some variables to make code
more understandable.

Added an Appal logo to the welcomeUser() function.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement exceptions for user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Exceptions are specific to each command: todo, event, deadline, and
mark. These exceptions are subclasses of the superclass AppalException,
which checks for generic invalid input.

Appal.java is edited such that methods can throw these exceptions when
necessary.

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug fix: Add constructor method that takes in a string argument
commitResults.messageBody:
This constructor method is needed for other subclasses of the
AppalException class to print a specific message.

commitResults.messageTitle: Appal.java: Refactor code
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a need to check if the todo, deadline, and event commands have
a specified task, hence the chunk of code is extracted out as a method
from the adTodo(), addDeadline() and addEvent() methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: Appal.java: Add exception and update named constants and handleInput()
commitResults.messageBody:
Added the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException to markTask() as any input that
is less than or equals to zero, or more than 100, will result in this
exception.

Some named constants were updated to make the chatbot interface look
more consistent.

In handleInput(), instead of creating a new Scanner object each time we
take in user input, a Scanner object is instantiated as an attribute of
the Appal class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update files for automated testing
Merge branch 'branch-Level-5'
Divide classes into packages
commitResults.messageBody: Organize the classes into suitable java packages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-Packages'
Implement taskList as an ArrayList instead of an array
commitResults.messageBody:
Used Java Collections classes for storing task data instead, as it
offer many advantages (e.g., dynamic sizing, easy to find/add/delete
items), over using a primitive data structure such as a normal array.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change exception type caught in markTask()
commitResults.messageBody:
Due to the change of type of the taskList from array to ArrayList, the
type of exception caught changed from ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException to
IndexOutOfBoundsException.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement delete task function
Implement function to load saved tasks from a text file
Implement function to write current tasks to a text file
commitResults.messageBody: Added formatting functions in the Task class and Task subclasses.

commitResults.messageTitle: Appal.java: Add message for successful loadExistingTasksData()
Add exceptions to handle I/O errors
Merge branch 'branch-Level-6'
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Appal.java: Improve code quality based on coding standards
commitResults.messageBody: Added named constants and line wrapping.

commitResults.messageTitle: Appal.java: Refactor code
